title: Orion Energy Surpasses $900 Million Target for Credit Fund
sub_head: The new pool likely will reach $1 billion, according to a person familiar with the situation
body:
Orion Energy Partners has raised $905 million so far for its latest energy-infrastructure credit fund, surpassing its target, and likely will wrap up with $1 billion in commitments, a person familiar with the matter said.
The New York-based firm had set a target of $900 million for Orion Energy Credit Opportunities Fund III LP, higher than the $816 million it raised for a predecessor fund, which closed to new investors in 2018. The latest pool is expected to close in this yearâ€™s second quarter, the person said.
